title: How does Google Fi compare to other carriers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Google Fi is an MVNO, not a carrier. (The carriers they use are TMobile, Sprint and US Cellular.) They compare pretty equally to MVNOs like Straight Talk, which uses AT&T, Sprint, TMobile and Verizon, just not at the same time. Fi uses all 3 in the same phone, with the same SIM, choosing the one that’s best where you are (usually - but it will hold on to a signal as it gets weak enough to lose a call before switching sometimes). It’s also more expensive than some of the others. It depends on what you need. (I’m always near WiFi, so I don’t need much data - so I get by with Mint Mobile - 3GB for $15/month.)

Google Fi has no infrastructure of its own. It licenses service from Sprint, T-Mobile, and US Cellular. Google Fi’s service will be as good as the best available of those three where ever you happen to be.
